post.description:
Given a prompt, the model will return one or more predicted completions, and can also return the probability of alternative tokens at each position.
Creates a completion for the provided prompt and parameters.

role.description: The role of the messages author. Choice between: system, user, or assistant.

messages.description: The list of messages in the conversation so far.

temperature.description: Sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both.

n.description: Defaults to 1. How many chat completion choices to generate for each input message.

top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

stream.description: Defaults to false. If set, partial message deltas will be sent, like in ChatGPT. Tokens will be sent as server-sent events as they become available, with data: [DONE] message terminating the stream.

stop.description: Defaults to null. Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

max_tokens.description: Defaults to inf. The maximum number of tokens to generate in the chat completion. The total length of input tokens and generated tokens is limited by the model's context length.

presence_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

frequency_penalty.description: Defaults to 0. Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

logit_bias.description: Modify the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion. Accepts a JSON object that maps tokens (specified by token ID as given by the tokenizer) to an associated bias value between -100 and 100. Mathematically, the bias is added to the logits generated by the model prior to sampling. The exact effect will vary per model, but values between -1 and 1 should decrease or increase likelihood; values like -100 or 100 should result in a ban or exclusive selection of the relevant token.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse.

response_format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output. Use { "type": "json_object" } to enable JSON mode, which ensures the model's message is valid JSON. Important: When using JSON mode, you must also instruct the model to produce JSON via system or user message. If you do not, the model may generate an endless stream of whitespace until generation hits the token limit, resulting in increased latency and a 'stuck' request. Also note that if finish_reason="length", the message content may be cut off, indicating generation exceeded max_tokens or the conversation exceeded the maximum context length.

seed.description: This feature is experimental. If specified, our system will make a best effort to sample deterministically, such that repeated requests with the same seed and parameters should return the same result. Determinism is not guaranteed, and you should refer to the system_fingerprint response parameter to monitor for backend changes.

tools.description: A set of tools the model can call. Currently, only functions are supported as tools. Use this to provide a list of functions the model can generate JSON inputs for.

tool_choice.description: Controls which function (if any) the model calls. none means the model will not call a function and will instead generate a message. auto means the model can decide to generate a message or call a function. Use {"type": "function", "function": {"name": "my_function"}} to force the model to call that function. If no functions exist, defaults to none. If functions exist, defaults to auto. Show possible types.

messages.content: What opportunities and challenges will the Chinese large model industry face in 2025?

input.prompt: cute anime girl with massive fennec ears and a big fluffy fox tail with long wavy blonde hair between eyes and large blue eyes blonde colored eyelashes chubby wearing oversized clothes summer uniform long blue maxi skirt muddy clothes happy sitting on the side of the road in a run down dark gritty cyberpunk city with neon and a crumbling skyscraper in the rain at night while dipping her feet in a river of water she is holding a sign that says 'ComfyUI is the best' written in cursive
A rubber duck flows in the golden river
a robot is running through a futuristic cyberpunk city with neon signs and darkness with bright HDR lights
input.negative_prompt: vivid color tone, overexposed, static, blurry details, subtitles, style, artwork, painting, frame, still, overall grayish, worst quality, low quality, JPEG compression artifacts, ugly, deformed, extra fingers, poorly drawn hands, poorly drawn face, distorted, disfigured, malformed limbs, fused fingers, motionless scene, messy background, three legs, crowded background, walking backward

input.prompt: a robot is running through a futuristic cyberpunk city with neon signs and darkness with bright HDR lights

file.description: support JPG, PNG, MP4, AVI, MOV, MKV, GIF, MP3, WAV, OGG and AAC

prompt.title: Prompt

seed.description: The same seed and the same prompt given to the same version of Stable Diffusion will output the same image every time.

num_images.description: The number of images to generate. Default value: 1

guidance_scale.description: The CFG (Classifier Free Guidance) scale is a measure of how close you want the model to stick to your prompt.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The text prompt to guide video generation.
prompt.example: The camera advances slowly from far to near.

negative_prompt.title: Negative Prompt
negative_prompt.example: vivid color tone, overexposed, static, blurry details, subtitles, style, artwork, painting, frame, still, overall grayish, worst quality, low quality, JPEG compression artifacts, ugly, deformed, extra fingers, poorly drawn hands, poorly drawn face, distorted, disfigured, malformed limbs, fused fingers, motionless scene, messy background, three legs, crowded background, walking backward

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: Random seed for reproducibility. If None, a random seed is chosen.

shift.title: Shift
shift.description: Shift value for the video. Must be between 1.0 and 10.0. Default value: 8

num_frames.title: Number of Frames
num_frames.description: Number of frames to generate. Must be between 81 to 121 (inclusive). Default value: 81

image_url.title: Image URL
image_url.description: URL of the input image. If the input image does not match the chosen aspect ratio, it is resized and center cropped.

frames_per_second.title: Frames per Second
frames_per_second.description: Frames per second of the generated video. Must be between 4 to 60. When using interpolation and adjust_fps_for_interpolation is set to true (default true,) the final FPS will be multiplied by the number of interpolated frames plus one. For example, if the generated frames per second is 16 and the number of interpolated frames is 1, the final frames per second will be 32. If adjust_fps_for_interpolation is set to false, this value will be used as-is. Default value: 16

resolution.title: Resolution
resolution.description: Resolution of the video to generate. Default value: 480p

aspect_ratio.title: Aspect Ratio
aspect_ratio.description: Aspect ratio of the generated video. If 'auto', the aspect ratio will be determined automatically based on the input image. Default value: auto

num_inference_steps.title: Number of Inference Steps
num_inference_steps.description: Number of inference steps for sampling. Higher values give better quality but take longer. Default value: 6

guidance_scale.title: Guidance Scale (1st Stage)
guidance_scale.description: Classifier-free Guidance Scale (1st Stage). Higher values give better adherence to the prompt but may decrease quality. Default value: 1

guidance_scale_2.title: Guidance Scale (2nd Stage)
guidance_scale_2.description: Classifier-free Guidance Scale (2nd Stage). Higher values give better adherence to the prompt but may decrease quality. Default value: 1

multi_audio_type.title: Multi_audio_type
multi_audio_type.description: The multi_audio_type parameter manages how multiple audio clips are combinChoose 'para' to mix them in parallel-playing all at once, great for blendound sounds with vocals. Pick 'add' to string them sequentially, one aftererfect for segmented speech or ordered audio snippets. It's all about whetant overlap or a continuous flow

frames_per_second.title: Frames per Second
frames_per_second.description: Frames per second of the generated video. Must be between 4 to 60. When using interpolation and adjust_fps_for_interpolation is set to true (default true,) the final FPS will be multiplied by the number of interpolated frames plus one. guidance_scale_2.title: Guidance Scale (2nd Stage)
guidance_scale_2.description: Guidance scale for the second stage of the model. This is used to control the adherence to the prompt in the second stage of the model. Default value: 1

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The text prompt to guide video generation.
prompt.example: From a subjective perspective, it seems as if you are running side by side with a pack of wolves in a snow-covered pine forest. The wolves nimbly moved among the trees, their exhaled breath condensing into white mist, and their steps were light and swift. Occasionally, the camera meets the gaze of a gray Wolf, brimming with wildness and freedom

frames_per_second.title: Frames per Second
frames_per_second.description: Frames per second of the generated video. Must be between 4 to 60. When using interpolation and adjust_fps_for_interpolation is set to true (default true,) the final FPS will be multiplied by the number of interpolated frames plus one. For example, if the generated frames per second is 16 and the number of interpolated frames is 1, the final frames per second will be 32. If adjust_fps_for_interpolation is set to false, this value will be used as-is. Default value: 16

num_inference_steps.title: Number of Inference Steps
num_inference_steps.description: Number of inference steps for sampling. Higher values give better quality but take longer. Default value: 8

guidance_scale.title: Guidance Scale (1st Stage)
guidance_scale.description: Classifier-free guidance scale. Higher values give better adherence to the prompt but may decrease quality. Default value: 1

guidance_scale_2.title: Guidance Scale (2nd Stage)
guidance_scale_2.description: Guidance scale for the second stage of the model. This is used to control the adherence to the prompt in the second stage of the model. Default value: 1

aspect_ratio.title: Aspect Ratio
aspect_ratio.description: Aspect ratio of the generated video. If 'auto', the aspect ratio will be determined automatically based on the input image. Default value: auto

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The text prompt to guide video generation.
prompt.example: A robot cooking in the kitchen.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: Random seed for reproducibility. If None, a random seed is chosen.

aspect_ratio.title: Aspect Ratio
aspect_ratio.description: Aspect ratio of the generated video. If 'auto', the aspect ratio will be determined automatically based on the input image. Default value: auto

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The prompt to generate the image with
prompt.example: 对这个世界如果你有太多的抱怨,跌倒了就不敢继续往前走

audio_url.title: Audio Url
audio_url.description: URL of audio to use for audio2audio

emotion.title: emotion
emotion.description: The emotion to use for generating the audio. Default value: None

language.title: language
language.description: The language to use for generating the audio. Default value: None

express.title: express
express.description: The express to use for generating the audio. Default value: None

temperature.title: temperature
temperature.description: The randomness and creativity in generating speech within the control model

max_length.title: max length
max_length.description: max_length can be adjusted according to the text length.

tags.title: custom mark
tags.description: Add experimental custom_mark, surrounding with '()', for example (温柔)(东北话), it may have an effect.

unload_model.title: Unload model
unload_model.description: Optional unload_model to choose whether to unload the model to accelerate inference speed.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The prompt to generate the image with
prompt.example:
[s1] What are you leaning so close for?
[s2] I never noticed you had this watch before.
[s1] I’ve had it for ages—you just never looked carefully enough before.
[s2] Well, I’m looking carefully now.

first_audio_url.title: Audio Url
first_audio_url.description: The audio url of the first speaker.

second_audio_url.title: Audio Url
second_audio_url.description: The audio url of the second speaker.

first_emotional_prompt.title: emotion
first_emotional_prompt.description: Emotional reference prompt words for Audio 1.

second_emotional_prompt.title: emotion
second_emotional_prompt.description: Emotional reference prompt words for Audio 2.

temperature.title: temperature
temperature.description: The randomness and creativity in generating speech within the control model

max_length.title: max length
max_length.description: max_length can be adjusted according to the text length.

Emo_alpha.title: max length
Emo_alpha.description: max_length can be adjusted according to the text length.

Emo_alpha_s2.title: max length
Emo_alpha_s2.description: max_length can be adjusted according to the text length.

use_emo_text.title: Use_emo_text
use_emo_text.description: Whether to enable prompt words to control emotions.

use_random.title: Use_random
use_random.description: Control whether the first audio enables random behavior (such as random seed generation, random shuffling of data, random voice style, etc.)

use_random_s2.title: Use_random_s2
use_random_s2.description: Control whether the second audio enables random behaviors (such as random seed generation, random data shuffling, random voice style, etc.)

unload_model.title: Unload model
unload_model.description: Optional unload_model to choose whether to unload the model to accelerate inference speed.

Authorization.description: Use the following format for authentication: Bearer [<your api key>](https://genbo.ai/apiTokens)
